definition: now/at present/at this juncture
this/these/(commonly pr. [zhei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing)
disposition of troops/wave/spate/burst/spell/short period of time/classifier for events or states of short duration
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: I always play mahjong at Guo's house.
sentences.chinese: 這陣子我老是去老郭家打牌。

sentences.english: I have more time to think these days, Jeff…I'm proud of you.
sentences.chinese: 這陣子我有更多的時間想些事情，傑夫，我爲你自豪。

sentences.english: No, good jobs are not so easy to come by these days.
sentences.chinese: 這陣子不太容易找到好的工作。

sentences.english: His veins had swelled with the effort of the cough, and the varicose ulcer had started itching.
sentences.chinese: 這陣子咳嗽，直叫他靜脈賁張，腳脖子也刺癢起來。

sentences.english: All the relevant food safety reports, shocking ah.
sentences.chinese: 這陣子有關食品安全的報道篇篇觸目驚心啊。

sentences.english: You look much slimmer these days!
sentences.chinese: 你這陣子看起來苗條多了。

sentences.english: We all give supports to Sichuan.
sentences.chinese: 這陣子，全世界都在支持四川。

sentences.english: Indian children these days seem to be leaning towards western ways too.
sentences.chinese: 印度孩子，這陣子似乎傾向於西方的方式。

definition: (Tw) from time to time/frequently
to prattle/to chatter away/to nag/garrulous/nagging
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
to leap and frisk about (idiom); lively/healthy and active
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
honestly speaking/to be frank, ...
bustling/energetic
to indulge in flights of fancy (idiom)/to let one's imagination run wild
to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
to be disappointing/to fail to live up to expectations
depressed/sulky/moody/unhappy
to be at a loss for words/speechless
hard to deal with/hard to get along with
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
